v.v: Give thanks to Yahweh; worship him and pray to him.
Sing to him; praise him as you sing to him;
Be proud of Yahweh, who alone is God.
Ask Yahweh to help you and give you his strength,
You people who are descendants of God’s servant Abraham,
He is Yahweh, our God.
He never forgets the covenant that he made;
That is the covenant that he made with Abraham,
Later he confirmed it again to Jacob
What he said was, “I will give you the region of Canaan;
He said that to them when there were only a few of them,
They continued to wander from one place to another,
But he did not allow others to oppress them.
“Do not do harm to the people whom I have chosen!
He sent a famine to Canaan, and as a result all the people had no food to eat.
So his people went to Egypt, but first he sent someone there.
Later, while Joseph was in prison in Egypt,
Joseph was in prison until the time
The king of Egypt sent servants, who set him free;
Then he appointed him to take care of everything in the king’s household,
Joseph was permitted to command the king’s important servants
Later, Joseph’s father Jacob arrived in Egypt.
Years later Yahweh caused the descendants of Jacob to become very numerous.
So Yahweh caused the rulers of Egypt to turn against the Israelite people,
But then Yahweh sent his servant Moses
Those two performed amazing miracles among the people of Egypt
Yahweh sent darkness so that the people of Egypt could not see anything,
Yahweh caused all the water in Egypt to become blood,
Then he caused the land to become full of frogs;
Then Yahweh commanded that flies come, and swarms of them descended on the people of Egypt,
Yahweh sent rain, rain that became hail that fell upon them,
The hail ruined their grapevines and fig trees
He commanded locusts to come, and hordes of them came;
The locusts ate every green plant in the land,
Then Yahweh killed the oldest son in every house of the people of Egypt.
Then he brought the Israelite people out from Egypt;
The people of Egypt were glad when the Israelite people left
Then Yahweh spread a cloud to cover the Israelites;
Later the Israelites asked for meat to eat,
One day he caused a rock to open up, and water poured out for them to drink;
He did that because he kept thinking about the sacred promise that he had given to his servant, Abraham.
So his people were joyful as he brought them out from Egypt;
He gave to them the land that belonged to the people groups that lived there in Canaan,
Yahweh did all these things

v: Tell everyone in the world what he has done!
tell others about his wonderful miracles.
You people who worship Yahweh, rejoice!
and always seek to be with him!
you descendants of Jacob, the people whom God has chosen,
think about all the wonderful things that he has done;
he performed miracles, and he punished all our enemies.
He rules and judges people throughout the earth.
he made a promise that will last for a thousand generations.
and he repeated that covenant with Isaac.
as a covenant for the Israelite people that would last forever.
it will belong to you and your descendants forever.”
a tiny group of people who were living in that land like strangers.
from one kingdom to another.
He warned those kings by saying to them,
Do not harm my prophets!”
He sent Joseph, who had been sold to be a slave.
they put his legs in shackles that hurt his feet,
and they put an iron collar around his neck.
the events he predicted came to pass.
This was how Yahweh tested Joseph.
this ruler released Joseph from prison.
to take care of everything that the king possessed.
to do anything that Joseph wanted them to do,
and even to tell the king’s advisors the things that they should do for the people of Egypt.
He lived like a foreigner in the land that belonged to the descendants of Ham.
As a result, their enemies, the Egyptians, considered that the Israelites were too strong.
and they began to oppress his people.
along with Moses’ older brother Aaron, whom Yahweh had also chosen to be his servant.
in that land where the descendants of Ham lived.
but the rulers of Egypt refused to obey when Moses and Aaron commanded them to let the Israelite people leave Egypt.
and his doing that caused all the fish to die.
the king and his officials even had frogs in their bedrooms.
and gnats also swarmed across the whole country.
and he sent wild fires that burned throughout their land.
and shattered all the other trees.
so many came that they could not be counted.
ruining all the crops.
they were carrying heavy loads of jewelry made of silver and gold that the people of Egypt had given to them.
No one was left behind because of being sick.
because they had become very afraid of the Israelites.
and at night it became a big fire in the sky to give them light.
and Yahweh sent flocks of quail to them,
and he gave them plenty of manna, food from the sky, each morning.
it was like a river flowing in that desert.
these people whom he had chosen were shouting joyfully as they went.
and the Israelites took all their wealth.
so that his people would do all the things that he had commanded them to do.
Praise Yahweh!
